channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Huge and unsafe footway repair, 21st January
item.description:
Huge and unsafe footway repair has been left for months. The yellow cover is regularly DRIVEN OVER and moves as located on a tight corner. Ground is uneven and unsafe and is located by a very busy large school. Urgent action to both make safe in the short term and to effect a long term repair.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 46, Gipsy Hill, West Norwood, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road surface damage and water ponding over CP Subway, 21st January
item.description:
We have road surface damage and water ponding over CP Subway, causing sustained water egress into the ground. Progressive road works means surface water now ponds directly over Grade II Subway, well after rain has stopped. This ponding likely slowly soaks into the ground above the Subway adding containments into the saturated ground. The heavily cracked road surface adds to surface water and contaminants soaking into the ground above the Subway. The ponding water and road surface break up above the CP Subway could be impacting how to prove a mains water leak in this area of road, and contributing to the ongoing leak seen inside the Grade II* CP Subway (and road over bridge). The road surface needs to relayed, and reprofiled to stop ponding of water on top of the Subway.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crystal Palace Parade, Crystal Palace, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
